It was founded as a [coaching](/wiki/Coaching) and [counselling](/wiki/Counselling) service offering group facilitation and transformation workshops, before a series of basic [dharma](/wiki/Dharma) courses began conducted in Singapore till today ## Biography Jian Xin became involved with [Buddhism](/wiki/Buddhism) at the age of 15, when she made the resolve to follow the [bodhisattva path](/wiki/Bodhisattva_path). She graduated from the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) and pursued further studies at Yuan Kuang Buddhist Institute in [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan). She obtained a master's degree in [Buddhist Studies](/wiki/Buddhist_Studies) from the [SOAS University of London](/wiki/SOAS_University_of_London).
